snippet.title: PC-98 : Akatsuki no Bizantira (JAP)
snippet.description:
Akatsuki no Bizantira (暁のビザンティラ) is an RPG that developed and published by ASCII Corporation back in 1994, exclusively for the NEC PC-98 computer system and the Japanese market.

The game is based on Hiroe Suga's manga novel of the same name and the story is focused on Bizantira's adventures in order to discover why the animals of the world started to attack humans.

Gameplay-wise is a is a very basic RPG, with random encouters and turn based battles. You wander around a top-down world map~unfortunately with  no icon~, exploring the world and visiting towns. There is no navigation in the towns; locations are selected through a menu.
In general, it's a very  minimal and straight forward RPG experience without any extraordinary feature.

Althought it's not an import friendly game, the lack of story development (not many texts) and the simple mechanics, make this game quite accessible to anyone.
